subject: Productivity
title: Mitochondria and Aging
description: A quick, practical guide to Mitochondria and Aging.

hook.text: Mitochondria are called the powerhouses of the cell. When they decline, so do you.

buildup.text: Each cell contains hundreds to thousands of mitochondria. They convert food into usable energy.

discovery.text: As we age, mitochondrial function declines. Less efficient energy production means less vitality.

twist.text: Exercise is the most powerful way to build new mitochondria. Movement literally creates new power plants in cells.

climax.text: Energy decline with age isn't inevitable. Exercise, sleep, and nutrition can maintain mitochondrial health.

punchline.text: Mitochondria age. Exercise makes new ones.

quiz.question: What is the most effective way to build new mitochondria?
